item.title: Littering between Queensbridge Road and Mansfield Court, 9th July
item.description:
This is the 3rd times I report this. Everytime I received a message saying the issue was sorted whilst it was not. I will not report it again on this website as this website is obviously flawed. I will send this enquiry to another department.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose Pavement cracking and starting to sink, 9th July
item.description:
Recent paving slab crack and wobbling. Sinking an inch. Frequently used as dropping off place for Barnehurst Station, so increased chances of someone falling. Location in Beverley Road, by drive for 67 Northall Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gas canisters, an old child play pram, wooden pallets and other general waste has been dumped outside of the old pop in parlour in Sherbrooke Close., 9th July
item.description:
Gas canisters, an old child play pram, wooden pallets and other general waste has been dumped outside of the old pop in parlour in Sherbrooke Close which require removing as resident is concerned about this attracting rats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sherbrooke Close, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars driving through a pedestrian/bike only traffic light, 9th July
item.description:
There is a set of traffic lights on Clapton common road by Portland avenue that are for a pedestrian/bike crossing. There is a bollard blocking car access from Portland Avenue onto the main road. I have now seen two cars drive around the bollard and onto the main road. Yesterday I thought the same was going to happen so I stayed on my bike in the way of the car behind me. The car then pulled into the driveway of 99 Clapton Common Road, drove through a gap in the wall, onto the pavement and onto the main road. I have seen cars use this route many times. Both routes are illegal and dangerous for pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Avenue, Stamford Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bin overflowing - continuous, 9th July
item.description:
Public bin that is continuously full and frequently overflowing outside the retail parade. This issue is causing strong odours and presents an unsightly and unhygienic environment for both pedestrians and nearby businesses. Could this please be looked into as a matter of urgency? If the current location is unsuitable for regular collection, perhaps the bin could be relocated or additional capacity provided.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Well Hall Parade, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Railway Avenue, Rotherhithe, London
